section.title: Setup
section.para: Download and install the software of the below list according the instructions to your operational system.

note.title: IDE tips
note.para:
The project build process is based on Maven 2, but you can adopt an IDE to facilitate your work. If you adopt Eclipse , for example, you can also install its Maven plugin, that will provide you a more safe development environment. For Netbeans or Idea users, maven is integrated by default.

listitem.para: First of all, please request the Observer role in the project: by sending an email to https://cejug-classifieds.dev.java.net/
Join the mailing list at https://cejug- classifieds.dev.java.net/servlets/ProjectMailingListList
Obtain and install Java at http://java.sun.com (Find instructions on how to install java at http://java.sun.com/javase/6/webnotes/install)

Install Glassfish and configure the environment variables (Use the following link for download: https://glassfish.dev.java.net) The instructions for installing glassfish can be found at http://www.installationwiki.org/Installing_GlassFish You will need to have ANT installed. Usually Glassfish comes with ANT included, but in the case you need to install it use the following link: http://ant.apache.org

Install Subversion Read more about subversion at https://cejug- classifieds.dev.java.net/servlets/ProjectSource For Subversion command-line client, you can dowload the subversion at http://www.collab.net/downloads/subversion For TortoiseSVN, you can download the suversion at http://tortoisesvn.net/downloads

section.para: TODO: continue docbook......... Extract the code from svn using the following steps 1) open a DOS console 2)Change directory to where you want to extract the code to. Type the following commands: *asadmin start-database *asadmin start-domain domain1 *svn checkout https://cejug-classifieds.dev.java.net/svn/cejug-classifieds/trunk/cejug- classifieds-server *username: Please use your java.net user name *password: Please use your java.net password CONFIGURING THE ENVIRONMENT VARIABLES ON WINDOWS PLATFORM JAVA_HOME: Java installed directory AS_HOME : Glassfish installed directory DERBY_HOME: The JavaDB embedded in Glassfish (it is in the AS_HOME/javadb) PATH: $PATH:$AS_HOME/bin:$DERBY_HOME/bin: $JAVA_HOME/bin ON LINUX PLATFORM export JAVA_HOME=/usr/lib/jvm/java-6-sun-1.6.0.06 export AS_HOME=/home/fgaucho/dev/glassfish export DERBY_HOME=$AS_HOME/javadb export PATH=$PATH:$AS_HOME/bin:$DERBY_HOME/bin:$JAVA_HOME/bin NOTE: After you installed everything, extracted the code from svn, and configured your environment variables, you can check your Glassfish installation: open a shell console and type: asadmin start-database asadmin start-domain domain1 Open a browser and type the following url: http://localhost:8080/cejug-classifieds-server If you see a welcome page then your evironment is well installed. USING ECLIPSE AS AN IDE Download eclipse from http://www.eclipse.org/ (Eclipse Ganymede is the recommended version for the glassfish plugins) To download Ganymede go to: http://www.eclipse.org/ganymede/ After installing eclipse install the glassfish plugins. To install the glassfish plugins into eclipse go to the following link: http://blogs.sun.com/ arungupta/entry/glassfish_on_eclipse_ganymede After this install open a command consol and type the following commands *asadmin start-database *asadmin start-domain domain1 Then come back into eclipse and * right click on the glassfish server to luch it. Wait til it starts Open a browser and type the following url: http://localhost:8080/cejug-classifieds-server If you see a welcome page then your evironment is well installed.

The source code can be checked out through any Subversion client. The generic command will be svn checkout https://cejug-classifieds.dev.java.net/svn/cejug-classifieds/trunk cejug-classifieds --username username

section.title: Getting out the sources
section.para: The Cejug Classifieds project is hosted on java.net at the location https://cejug-classifieds.dev.java.net/

The source code can be checked out through any Subversion client. The generic command will be svn checkout https://cejug-classifieds.dev.java.net/svn/cejug-classifieds/trunk cejug-classifieds --username username
